chapter.title: Acknowledgements
chapter.para: We would like to thank the following organizations and corporations for supporting and sponsoring the development of eXist:

tr.td: Trapeze Networks, headquartered in Pleasanton, Calif., has continuously sponsored improvements and new features since 2004 and helped to advance development by testing and deploying eXist in a production environment.

Major parts of the XQuery implementation were motivated and sponsored by the project: "Exemplarische Internet-Edition der Werke des jungen Goethe und Jakob Michael Reinhold Lenz'", funded by the Fritz-Thyssen Stiftung. Project lead: Prof. Dr. Karl Eibl (Institut für Deutsche Philologie, Ludwig- Maximilians- Universität München), Prof. Dr. Fotis Jannidis (Institut für Sprach- und Literaturwissenschaft, TU Darmstadt).

A number of features, including user management, XQuery extensions and the bibliographic demo were developed within the context of the project: SozioNet, a German social-science portal. SozioNet has been funded by the German Federal Ministry For Education and Research. Project lead: Prof. Dr. Rudi Schmiede (Institut für Soziologie, TU Darmstadt).
The eXist Wiki, the demo server and other vital parts of our project infrastructure are kindly hosted by CSW Group Ltd. in the UK.
